required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects Of Ropinirole On Mood Or Mild Depression In Patients With Moderate To Severe Restless Legs Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter 3:1-randomized Placebo-controlled Double-blind Phase IIIb Study on the Effects of Ropinirole on Mood/(Subclinical) Depression in the Therapy of Patients With Moderate to Severe Idiopathic RLS in Germany

brief_summary.textblock: Ropinirole has shown to improve mood in depressed patients as well as to improve the symptoms of Restless Legs Syndrome. Up to 40% of RLS patients suffer from mild depression, therefore it would be important for decisions no therapy to know whether a drug could improve both depressive and RLS symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Change of the MADRS (Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale) Total Score From Baseline to Final Visit After 12 Weeks of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)is a 10 item questionaire preformed during a clinical interview asking broad to detailed questions about symptoms which allows a precise rating of severity of symptoms of the past week. Questions are scored 0-6. Total Score 0-60, the higher the score indicates the most severely depressed patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Change of the MADRS (Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale) Total Score From Baseline to Final Visit After 12 Weeks of Treatment in Participants With Signs of at Least Moderate Depression (MADRS Score: >=18)
secondary_outcome.description: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)is a 10 item questionaire preformed during a clinical interview asking broad to detailed questions about symptoms which allows a precise rating of severity of symptoms of the past week. Questions are scored 0-6. Total Score 0-60, the higher the score indicates the most severely depressed patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Change of the HAM-D (Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, 17-item-Version) Total Score From Baseline to Final Visit After 12 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression contains 17 questions which detect change and measure illness severity. Individual items are rated on a scale of 0-4, 0-3, and 0-2 with total HAMD score range from 0 (not ill) to 54 (severely ill).

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Change of the HAM-D Total Score From Baseline to Final Visit After 12 Weeks of Treatment in Participants With Signs of an at Least Moderate Depression (HAM-D Score >= 15) at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression contains 17 questions which detect change and measure illness severity. Individual items are rated on a scale of 0-4, 0-3, and 0-2 with total HAMD score range from 0 (not ill) to 54(severely ill).

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Change of the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) Total Score From Baseline to Final Visit After 12 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Becks Depression Inventory (BDI) is a 21 item self inventory evaluating symptoms of depression, cognition, and physical symptoms of fatigue, weight loss, and lack of interest in sex. The Higher the score represents most severely depressed participants. Score range for each items is 0-3 and Total score 0-63.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Change of the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) Total Score From Baseline to Final Visit After 12 Weeks of Treatment in Participants With Signs of an at Least Mild-moderate Depression (BDI >= 21) at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Becks Depression Inventory (BDI) is a 21 item self inventory evaluating symptoms of depression, cognition, and physical symptoms of fatigue, weight loss, and lack of interest in sex. The Higher the score represents most severely depressed participants. Score range for each items is 0-3 and total score 0-63.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least Moderate Depression (MADRS Score >= 18) at Baseline and in Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)is a 10 item questionaire preformed during a clinical interview asking broad to detailed questions about symptoms which allows a precise rating of severity of symptoms of the past week. Questions are scored 0-6. Total Score 0-60, the higher the score indicates the most severely depressed patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least Moderate Depression (HAM-D >= 15) at Baseline and in Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression contains 17 questions which detect change and measure illness severity. Individual items are rated on a scale of 0-4, 0-3, and 0-2 with total HAMD score range from 0 (not ill) to 54 (severely ill).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants ("Responder") With a Decrease of MADRS Total Score of at Least 6 Points After 12 Weeks Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)is a 10 item questionaire preformed during a clinical interview asking broad to detailed questions about symptoms which allows a precise rating of severity of symptoms of the past week. Questions are scored 0-6. Total Score 0-60, the higher the score indicates the most severely depressed patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants ("Responder") With a Decrease of MADRS Total Score of at Least 6 Points After 12 Weeks Compared to Baseline in Subjects With Signs of at Least Moderate Depression at Baseline (MADRS Score >= 18)
secondary_outcome.description: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)is a 10 item questionaire preformed during a clinical interview asking broad to detailed questions about symptoms which allows a precise rating of severity of symptoms of the past week. Questions are scored 0-6. Total Score 0-60, the higher the score indicates the most severely depressed patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Average MADRS Score From Baseline to Final Visit (Week 12) in Participants With Major Depressive Episodes (Diagnosed by MINI Interview Modules A, B and C / DSM Criteria)

Questions are scored 0-6. Total Score 0-60, the higher the score indicates the most severely depressed patients.

The Higher the score represents most severely depressed participants. Score range for each items is 0-3 and Total score 0-63.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Average International Restless Legs Scale for Severity (IRLS) Scores in All Participants From Baseline to After 1, 4, and 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: International Restless Legs Scale for Severity (IRLS)is a series of 10 questions which rate severity from 0-4 points for various questions and total score ranks: Very severe=31-40 points, Severe=21-30 points, Moderate=11-20 points, and Mild=1-10 points, None=0 points

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Decrease of International Restless Legs Scale (IRLS) Scores of at Least 6 Points After 1, 4 and 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: International Restless Legs Scale for Severity (IRLS)is a series of 10 questions which rate severity from 0-4 points for various questions and total score ranks: Very severe=31-40 points, Severe=21-30 points, Moderate=11-20 points, and Mild=1-10 points, None=0 points

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With "Much Improved" or "Very Much Improved" on the Clinical Global Impression-Global Improvement Scale After 1, 4 and 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI-I assesses the investigator's impression of the patient's current illness. The time span is the week before the rating and the score range: 1-very much improved, 2-much improved, 3-minimally improved, 4-no change, 5- minimally worse, 6-much worse, to 7-very much worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Average Baseline Score of Subscale of "Somnolence" in the Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) to Final Visit After 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Medical Outcome Study Sleep Scale (MOS-SS)-is a 12 item questionaire assessing sleep disturbance, sleep adequacy, somnolence, quantity of sleep, snoring, and awakening short of breath or with a headache. 10 question score from 1-6, 1 question scores 1-5 and 1 question asks average number of hours sleep each night.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Average Baseline Scores of Subscale "Sleep Disturbance" of the Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) to Final Visit After 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Medical Outcome Study Sleep Scale (MOS-SS)-is a 12 item questionaire assessing sleep disturbance, sleep adequacy, somnolence, quantity of sleep, snoring, and awakening short of breath or with a headache. 10 question score from 1-6, 1 question scores 1-5 and 1 question asks average number of hours sleep each night.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Average Baseline Scores of Subscale "Sleep Adequacy" of the Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale (MOS-SS)to Final Visit After 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Medical Outcome Study Sleep Scale (MOS-SS)-is a 12 item questionaire assessing sleep disturbance, sleep adequacy, somnolence, quantity of sleep, snoring, and awakening short of breath or with a headache. 10 question score from 1-6, 1 question scores 1-5 and 1 question asks average number of hours sleep each night.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Average Baseline Scores of Subscale "Sleep Quantity" (Hours) of the Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) to Final Visit After 12 Weeks

clinical_study.condition: Moderate to Severe Idiopathic Restless Legs Syndrome (RLS)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- diagnosis of idiopathic Restless Legs Syndrome, confirmed by a score of at least 11 on the RLS Diagnostic Index
- certain severity of symptoms (at least score of 15 on the International Restless Legs Score (IRLS)
- Have had RLS symptoms for at least 15 nights in the last four weeks.
- < 6 hours of sleep in nights with RLS symptoms
- MADRS (depression rating scale) score of at least 12 (= borderline to depression) at baseline
Exclusion criteria:
- any other sleep disorder that might interfere with the RLS symptoms or sleep (e.g. sleep apnea disorder, narcolepsy)
- Secondary RLS due to diagnosis of renal insufficiency, polyneuropathy, pregnancy (see below), iron deficiency anemia
- Any significant psychiatric disorders (e.g. schizophrenia, bipolar disorder); depression which by judgement of the investigator is caused by RLS, is not an exclusion criterion.
- Current or past suicidality
- medication known to trigger/aggravate/ cause or interfere with RLS symptoms (e.g. most antidepressants, lithium, neuroleptics, opioids, carbidopa, clonidine, antihistamines, anticonvulsants etc.).
- daytime RLS symptoms which require treatment (daytime: 10 a.m. until 6 p.m.).
- concomitant movement disorders (e.g. Parkinson's Disease, dyskinesia, dystonia).
- medical conditions with symptoms which could affect assessments of efficacy (e.g. diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis, fibromyalgia syndrome, cancer etc.).
- Subjects taking any medication known to induce drowsiness or to affect sleep.
- Subjects who are pregnant, lactating or of childbearing potential. Women of childbearing potential must use adequate contraception
- clinically significant or unstable medical conditions (e.g. severe heart disease, severe liver or kidney disease etc.).
- pain syndromes, caused by other disorders than RLS
- excessive caffeine intake
- diastolic blood pressure >110mmHg or <50mmHg or systolic blood pressure >180mmHg or <90mmHg at baseline.
- Withdrawal, introduction, or change in dose of hormone replacement therapy (HRT) or the oral contraceptive pill (OCP) and/or certain drugs which are known to interact with ropinirole (e.g. ciprofloxacin, cimetidine, tobacco, omeprazole).

group.title: Ropinirole
group.description: Subjects who were treated on day 1-2 with 0.25 mg/day of ropinirole and on days 3-7 0.5 mg for 12 weeks if tolerated. After two weeks, dose could be increased weekly by 0.5mg a day up to 4 mg maximum dose.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who took no investigational product.

participants_list.participants: 199 were randomized. Only 198 took investigational product.

group.title: Ropinirole
group.description: Subjects who were treated on day 1-2 with 0.25 mg/day of ropinirole and on days 3-7 0.5 mg for 12 weeks if tolerated. After two weeks, dose could be increased weekly by 0.5mg a day up to 4 mg maximum dose.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who took no investigational product.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Average Change of the MADRS (Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale) Total Score From Baseline to Final Visit After 12 Weeks of Treatment
outcome.description: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)is a 10 item questionaire preformed during a clinical interview asking broad to detailed questions about symptoms which allows a precise rating of severity of symptoms of the past week. Questions are scored 0-6. Total Score 0-60, the higher the score indicates the most severely depressed patients.
outcome.population: Modified Intent to Treat (mITT): All treated patients with MADRS score at baseline and post baseline (i.e., at visit 4 and/or 5). The High/Low scores for this population were 32/11.

analysis.estimate_desc: Mean difference = Ropinirole minus Placebo. Used adjusted change from baseline.

outcome.title: Average Change of the MADRS (Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale) Total Score From Baseline to Final Visit After 12 Weeks of Treatment in Participants With Signs of at Least Moderate Depression (MADRS Score: >=18)
outcome.description: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)is a 10 item questionaire preformed during a clinical interview asking broad to detailed questions about symptoms which allows a precise rating of severity of symptoms of the past week. Questions are scored 0-6. Total Score 0-60, the higher the score indicates the most severely depressed patients.
outcome.population: Modified Intent to Treat (mITT): All treated patients with MADRS score at baseline and post baseline (i.e., at visit 4 and/or 5). Sub-population with MADRS scores>=18: Ropinirole 91 and Placebo 29. The high/Low scores for the mITT population were 32/11.

measure.title: Change in Average MADRS Score From Baseline to Final Visit (Week 12) in Participants With Major Depressive Episodes (Diagnosed by MINI Interview Modules A, B and C / DSM Criteria)
measure.description: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)is a 10 item questionaire preformed during a clinical interview asking broad to detailed questions about symptoms which allows a precise rating of severity of symptoms of the past week. Questions are scored 0-6. Total Score 0-60, the higher the score indicates the most severely depressed patients.
measure.population: Modified Intent to Treat (mITT): All treated patients with MADRS score at baseline and post baseline (i.e., at visit 4 and/or 5). Sub-population diagnosed by MINI interview with Major Depressive Episodes: Ropinirole 93 and Placebo 34

outcome.title: Change in Average HAM-D Score From Baseline to Final Visit (Week 12) in Participants With Major Depressive Episodes (Diagnosed by MINI Interview Modules A, B and C / DSM Criteria)
outcome.description: The Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression contains 17 questions which detect change and measure illness severity. Individual items are rated on a scale of 0-4, 0-3, and 0-2 with total HAMD score range from 0 (not ill) to 54 (severely ill).
outcome.population: Modified Intent to Treat (mITT): All treated patients with MADRS score at baseline and post baseline (i.e., at visit 4 and/or 5). Sub-population diagnosed by MINI interview with Major Depressive Episodes: Ropinirole 90 and Placebo 31.

group.title: Ropinirole
group.description: Subjects who were treated on day 1-2 with 0.25 mg/day of ropinirole and on days 3-7 0.5 mg for 12 weeks if tolerated. After two weeks, dose could be increased weekly by 0.5mg a day up to 4 mg maximum dose.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who took no investigational product.

measure.title: Change in Average HAM-D Score From Baseline to Final Visit (Week 12) in Participants With Major Depressive Episodes (Diagnosed by MINI Interview Modules A, B and C / DSM Criteria)
measure.description: The Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression contains 17 questions which detect change and measure illness severity. Individual items are rated on a scale of 0-4, 0-3, and 0-2 with total HAMD score range from 0 (not ill) to 54 (severely ill).
measure.population: Modified Intent to Treat (mITT): All treated patients with MADRS score at baseline and post baseline (i.e., at visit 4 and/or 5). Sub-population diagnosed by MINI interview with Major Depressive Episodes: Ropinirole 90 and Placebo 31.

outcome.title: Change in Average BDI Score From Baseline to Final Visit (Week 12) in Participants With Major Depressive Episodes (Diagnosed by MINI Interview Modules A, B and C / DSM Criteria)
outcome.description: Becks Depression Inventory (BDI) is a 21 item self inventory evaluating symptoms of depression, cognition, and physical symptoms of fatigue, weight loss, and lack of interest in sex. The Higher the score represents most severely depressed participants. Score range for each items is 0-3 and Total score 0-63.
outcome.population: Modified Intent to Treat (mITT): All treated patients with MADRS score at baseline and post baseline (i.e., at visit 4 and/or 5). Sub-population diagnosed by MINI interview with Major Depressive Episodes: Ropinirole 91 and Placebo 34. High/Low BDI scores for this population were 46/2.

group.title: Ropinirole
group.description: Subjects who were treated on day 1-2 with 0.25 mg/day of ropinirole and on days 3-7 0.5 mg for 12 weeks if tolerated. After two weeks, dose could be increased weekly by 0.5mg a day up to 4 mg maximum dose.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who took no investigational product.

measure.title: Change in Average BDI Score From Baseline to Final Visit (Week 12) in Participants With Major Depressive Episodes (Diagnosed by MINI Interview Modules A, B and C / DSM Criteria)
measure.description: Becks Depression Inventory (BDI) is a 21 item self inventory evaluating symptoms of depression, cognition, and physical symptoms of fatigue, weight loss, and lack of interest in sex. The Higher the score represents most severely depressed participants. Score range for each items is 0-3 and Total score 0-63.
measure.population: Modified Intent to Treat (mITT): All treated patients with MADRS score at baseline and post baseline (i.e., at visit 4 and/or 5). Sub-population diagnosed by MINI interview with Major Depressive Episodes: Ropinirole 91 and Placebo 34. High/Low BDI scores for this population were 46/2.

outcome.title: Change in Average International Restless Legs Scale for Severity (IRLS) Scores in All Participants From Baseline to After 1, 4, and 12 Weeks
outcome.description: International Restless Legs Scale for Severity (IRLS)is a series of 10 questions which rate severity from 0-4 points for various questions and total score ranks: Very severe=31-40 points, Severe=21-30 points, Moderate=11-20 points, and Mild=1-10 points, None=0 points
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT): All patients of the safety population with any psychometric data at baseline (within a single questionnaire)

group.title: Ropinirole
group.description: Subjects who were treated on day 1-2 with 0.25 mg/day of ropinirole and on days 3-7 0.5 mg for 12 weeks if tolerated. After two weeks, dose could be increased weekly by 0.5mg a day up to 4 mg maximum dose.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who took no investigational product.

measure.title: Change in Average International Restless Legs Scale for Severity (IRLS) Scores in All Participants From Baseline to After 1, 4, and 12 Weeks
measure.description: International Restless Legs Scale for Severity (IRLS)is a series of 10 questions which rate severity from 0-4 points for various questions and total score ranks: Very severe=31-40 points, Severe=21-30 points, Moderate=11-20 points, and Mild=1-10 points, None=0 points
measure.population: Intent to Treat (ITT): All patients of the safety population with any psychometric data at baseline (within a single questionnaire)

outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT): All patients of the safety population with any psychometric data at baseline (within a single questionnaire)

measure.description: International Restless Legs Scale for Severity (IRLS)is a series of 10 questions which rate severity from 0-4 points for various questions and total score ranks: Very severe=31-40 points, Severe=21-30 points, Moderate=11-20 points, and Mild=1-10 points, None=0 points
measure.population: Intent to Treat (ITT): All patients of the safety population with any psychometric data at baseline (within a single questionnaire)

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Much Improved or Very Much Improved on the Clinical Global Impression-Global Improvement Scale After 1, 4 and 12 Weeks
outcome.description: The CGI-I assesses the investigator's impression of the patient's current illness. The time span is the week before the rating and the score range: 1-very much improved, 2-much improved, 3-minimally improved, 4-no change, 5- minimally worse, 6-much worse, to 7-very much worse.
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT): All patients of the safety population with any psychometric data at baseline (within a single questionnaire)

group.title: Ropinirole
group.description: Subjects who were treated on day 1-2 with 0.25 mg/day of ropinirole and on days 3-7 0.5 mg for 12 weeks if tolerated. After two weeks, dose could be increased weekly by 0.5mg a day up to 4 mg maximum dose.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who took no investigational product.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Much Improved or Very Much Improved on the Clinical Global Impression-Global Improvement Scale After 1, 4 and 12 Weeks
measure.description: The CGI-I assesses the investigator's impression of the patient's current illness. The time span is the week before the rating and the score range: 1-very much improved, 2-much improved, 3-minimally improved, 4-no change, 5- minimally worse, 6-much worse, to 7-very much worse.
measure.population: Intent to Treat (ITT): All patients of the safety population with any psychometric data at baseline (within a single questionnaire)

outcome.title: Change From Average Baseline Score of Subscale of Somnolence in the Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) to Final Visit After 12 Weeks
outcome.description: Medical Outcome Study Sleep Scale (MOS-SS)-is a 12 item questionaire assessing sleep disturbance, sleep adequacy, somnolence, quantity of sleep, snoring, and awakening short of breath or with a headache. 10 question score from 1-6, 1 question scores 1-5 and 1 question asks average number of hours sleep each night.
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT): All patients of the safety population with any psychometric data at baseline (within a single questionnaire)

group.title: Ropinirole
group.description: Subjects who were treated on day 1-2 with 0.25 mg/day of ropinirole and on days 3-7 0.5 mg for 12 weeks if tolerated. After two weeks, dose could be increased weekly by 0.5mg a day up to 4 mg maximum dose.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centres of a multi-centre trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
